001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import org.apache.commons.io.FilenameUtils;
004import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
005
006import java.io.File;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.nio.file.Files;
009import java.nio.file.Path;
010import java.nio.file.Paths;
011import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
012import java.util.Base64;
013import java.util.Comparator;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.stream.Collectors;
016import java.util.stream.Stream;
017import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
018
019/**
020 * Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
021 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
022 */
023public class CoreFileUtils {
024
025    /**
026     * Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed content
027     * that allows to use it in HTML-attributes
028     * (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
029     *
030     * @param contentToEncode the text-content to encode
031     * @return Base64-encoded content
032     */
033    public static String encodeBase64(String contentToEncode) {
034        return encodeBase64(contentToEncode.getBytes());
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Utility-method that provides Base64-encoding of the passed array of bytes
039     * that allows to use it in HTML-attributes
040     * (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
041     *
042     * @param bytesArr the binary-content to encode
043     * @return Base64-encoded content
044     */
045    public static String encodeBase64(byte[] bytesArr) {
046        return new String(Base64.getEncoder().encode(bytesArr));
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Load the content of image-file with, encodes its content {@link Base64#getEncoder() Base64-encoder}
051     * and prepend it with corresponding mime-type prefix in order to use that final value
052     * either in HTML-attributes (for HTTP-URL parameter - additional URL-encoding should be applied).
053     * <hr/>
054     * For more advanced detection it's recommended to use <a href="https://tika.apache.org/">Apache Tika</a>
055     *
056     * @param imageFile a file to load the text of binary content
057     * @return a data-string to use in HTML-attributes
058     */
059    public static String imageFileData64(File imageFile) {
060        byte[] imageFileContent = loadFileAsBytes(imageFile);
061        String imageFileExt = FilenameUtils.getExtension(imageFile.getPath());
062        String dataPrefix = switch (imageFileExt.toLowerCase()) {
063            case "jpg", "jpeg" -> "data:image/jpg;base64,";
064            case "png" -> "data:image/png;base64,";
065            case "gif" -> "data:image/gif;base64,";
066            case "svg" -> "data:image/svg+xml;base64,";
067            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
068                "could not detect the mime-type of file '%s' by extension '.%s'",
069                imageFile, imageFileExt));
070        };
071        return dataPrefix + encodeBase64(imageFileContent);
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}.
076     * <hr/>
077     * This operation is inversion of standard static methods {@link Path#of(String, String...)}
078     * or {@link Paths#get(String, String...)} - so, following expressions are identical:<pre>{@code
079     *     pathParts(Path.of("a/b/c"))
080     *     pathParts(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
081     *     Stream.of("a", "b", "c")
082     * }</pre>
083     *
084     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
085     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;}
086     */
087    public static Stream<String> pathParts(Path path) {
088        return StreamSupport.stream(path.spliterator(), false).map(Path::toString);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Getting the sequence of {@link Path}-components as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
093     * - so, following expressions are identical:<pre>{@code
094     *      pathPartsList(Path.of("a/b/c"))
095     *      pathPartsList(Path.of("a", "b", "c"))
096     *      List.of("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns unmodifiable implementation of List
097     *      Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c")  // <-- this returns modifiable instance of ArrayList
098     * }</pre>
099     *
100     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
101     * @return components of {@link Path} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
102     */
103    public static List<String> pathPartsList(Path path) {
104        return pathParts(path).toList();
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Joining the {@link #pathParts(Path) stream of path components} with {@link File#separator}
109     * - so, the assertions like following are always correct:<pre>{@code
110     *     assertThat(pathPartsStr(Path.of("a/b/c"))).isEqualTo("a/b/c")
111     * }</pre>
112     * <hr/>
113     * There could be some surprises with un-normalized parts of path, which includes reference to parent directory.
114     * Such cases must be handled and tests properly, because the family of methods {@code pathPartsXXX} is
115     * just a pure representation of path-parts without additional handling them.
116     *
117     * @param path an instance of {@link Path}
118     * @return the sequence of {@link Path}-components joining with {@link File#separator}
119     */
120    public static String pathPartsStr(Path path) {
121        return pathParts(path).collect(Collectors.joining(File.separator));
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * The same as {@link #loadFileAsText(File)}, but accept the path to that file as {@link String}
126     *
127     * @param pathToLoadStr the path of file to laod as {@link String}
128     * @return the content of that file as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
129     */
130    public static String loadFileAsText(String pathToLoadStr) {
131        return loadFileAsText(Paths.get(pathToLoadStr).toFile());
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@link String} (it's allowed to use for text-files only)
136     * and throws {@link IllegalStateException} if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
137     *
138     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
139     * @return the content of {@code fileToLoad} as {@link String}
140     */
141    public static String loadFileAsText(File fileToLoad) {
142        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
143            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
144                "could not load the file %s as text, because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
145                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
146        }
147        try {
148            return Files.readString(fileToLoad.toPath());
149        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
150            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
151                "could not load the file '%s' as text, because of IOException", fileToLoad), ioEx);
152        }
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@code byte[]}  and throws {@link IllegalStateException}
157     * if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
158     *
159     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
160     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
161     */
162    public static byte[] loadFileAsBytes(File fileToLoad) {
163        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
164            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
165                "could not load the file %s as bytes, because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
166                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
167        }
168        try {
169            return Files.readAllBytes(fileToLoad.toPath());
170        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
171            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
172                "could not load the file '%s' as bytes, because of IOException", fileToLoad), ioEx);
173        }
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Loading the content of {@code file} as list of lines,
178     * where each line is an element of returning {@link List} of {@link String}.
179     *
180     * @param filePathToLoad path of file to read the content as lines
181     * @return the content of {@code filePathToLoad} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
182     */
183    public static List<String> loadFileLines(Path filePathToLoad) {
184        if (filePathToLoad == null) {
185            throw new IllegalStateException(
186                "the path to file to load lines MUST NOT be null");
187        }
188        try (Stream<String> lines = Files.lines(filePathToLoad)) {
189            return lines.toList();
190        } catch (Exception ex) {
191            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
192                "could not load the file '%s' as list of lines", filePathToLoad), ex);
193        }
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Saving the content into the file {@code fileToSave} (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated).
198     * All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
199     *
200     * @param fileToSave the file to save into
201     * @param fileContent the content to be saved
202     * @throws IllegalStateException in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)
203     */
204    public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent) {
205        if (fileToSave == null) {
206            throw new IllegalStateException(
207                "could not save the file content, because fileToSave is null");
208        }
209        try {
210            if (fileToSave.getParentFile() != null) {
211                Files.createDirectories(fileToSave.getParentFile().toPath());
212            }
213            Files.writeString(fileToSave.toPath(), fileContent);
214        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
215            throw new IllegalStateException("could not save the content into the file " + fileToSave, ioEx);
216        }
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Copy the file {@code sourceFile} to the file {@code targetFile}
221     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.
222     */
223    public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile) {
224        if (sourceFile == null || !sourceFile.isFile()) {
225            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
226                "could not copy the file %s because it's not a normal file",
227                sourceFile == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + sourceFile + "'"));
228        }
229        if (targetFile == null) {
230            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
231                "could not copy the file '%s' because target file is null", sourceFile));
232        }
233        try {
234            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
235                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
236            }
237            Files.copy(sourceFile.toPath(), targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
238        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
239            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
240                "could not copy the file '%s' into '%s' because of IOException",
241                sourceFile, targetFile), ioEx);
242        }
243    }
244
245    /**
246     * The same as {@link Files#deleteIfExists(Path)}, but ignore any kind of {@link IOException}.
247     * <hr/>
248     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> For non-empty directory the method {@link #removeSilent(File)} should be used,
249     * because this method will always return {@code false} for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
250     *
251     * @param pathToRemove the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
252     * @return {@code true} if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or {@code false} otherwise
253     */
254    public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove) {
255        if (pathToRemove == null) {
256            return false;
257        }
258        try {
259            return Files.deleteIfExists(pathToRemove);
260        } catch (IOException ignored) {
261            return false;
262        }
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
267     *
268     * @param fileOrDirToRemove path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
269     * @return the number of removed items
270     */
271    public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove) {
272        if (fileOrDirToRemove == null) {
273            return -1;
274        }
275        if (!fileOrDirToRemove.exists()) {
276            return 0;
277        }
278        try {
279            if (fileOrDirToRemove.isFile()) {
280                return fileOrDirToRemove.delete() ? 1 : 0;
281            }
282            try (Stream<Path> walkPathStream = Files.walk(fileOrDirToRemove.toPath())) {
283                return (int) walkPathStream.sorted(Comparator.reverseOrder()) // Sort in reverse order to delete contents before directories
284                    .filter(CoreFileUtils::removePathSilent)
285                    .count();
286            }
287        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
288            return -2;
289        }
290    }
291
292    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
293
294    private CoreFileUtils() {
295        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
296        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
297    }
298}
